result.markdown: --- title: "Welcome!" date: "September 02, 2025" format: revealjs: theme: - default css: custom.scss transition: fade slide-number: true incremental: false chalkboard: true center: true execute: freeze: auto echo: true --- ## Environmental Justice: A Community-Centric Approach {data-background-color="#687b1a"} | | ::: columns ::: {.column style="width: 50%; font-size: 70%;"} **Course Number:** ES-202-01 **Time:** Tues & Fri 9:55 - 11:10 AM **Location:** Science Center Hub 103 Classroom **Instructor:** Dr. Mariah D. Caballero ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](images/logo.png){.absolute bottom=-30 right=0 height="85%"} ::: ::: ## About Me {.smaller} - Mariah Caballero - Call me Dr./Professor Caballero, or Dr./Professor Cab - She/her pronouns - New to Wellesley! - PhD in Community Research and Action from Vanderbilt University, concentration in Climate and Energy Policy - Use GIS/data science, policy analysis, and EJ theory to conduct research ## Name Placard {.smaller} - I'll bring these to our class meetings to learn names faster (I'm a visual learner!) and take attendance - Write... - Name - Pronouns - Add... - Stickers !! ## Now You - Name - Pronouns - Favorite sticker and why ## Note on placards - Identity evolves on a non-academic schedule - If you ever want to change any aspect of your placard throughout the course, let me know! ## About This Course ::: columns ::: {.column style="width: 50%; font-size: 70%;"} - Traditional take on Environmental Justice tends to focus on *Distributional* and *Recognitional* Justice - My take on Environmental Justice: - Expansive movement that welcomes everyone into belonging - Community-based - Solutions-focused - Expands ideas of justice to include both theory and methods ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](images/Forms_of_Justice.png){.absolute bottom=0 right=0} ::: ::: ## How my own path inspired this course {.smaller} - Vassar College (undergrad) - First conceptions of EJ + interdisciplinarity - USEPA Drinking Water Management Branch - Data to support lived experiences - Community engagement - Vanderbilt CRA - Community engaged research - Interdisciplinary research for advocacy ![](images/grad.JPG){.absolute bottom=-60 right=0} ## Course Design ::: columns :::{.column style="width: 60%; font-size: 60%;"} - **Tuesdays:** Large and small discussions on foundational EJ theory - **Fridays:** Community case study data visualization activity (in-class pairs, submitted individually) - **First 9 weeks:** Community case studies centered on past and present; introduction to R - **Last 5 weeks:** Present and future-looking community case studies; final project prep ::: :::{.column style="width: 40%; font-size: 60%;"} | Course Components | % of Grade | |------------------------------------|-------------| | Participation + Attendance | 10% | | Weekly Assignments | 65% | | Community Case Study Final Project | 25% | ::: ::: ## My Pedogogical Goals{.smaller} - **Reflect on your own identity** and how it relates to EJ-related research and action. - Build a course community that **recognizes and values** one another's strengths. - Learn applicable **interdisciplinary skills to research and advocate for** EJ-related challenges - Individual homework and group final project - All assignments are <= 10% - I want our classroom to be a safe, kind, and generative space! ## Check-in - What interests you about this course? - Anything you're excited/unsure about? ## What I Know About You ## Mixed Bag of Learners ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](01-Welcome_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Variety of Interests ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](01-Welcome_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Primed for Interdisciplinary Thinking ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](01-Welcome_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Ready to Learn R! ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](01-Welcome_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## A Note on My First Semester - New course + new institution = **lots** of learning - Will likely ask for more feedback than other professors - Syllabus is complete, but may make small changes along the way as I receive feedback ## The Wellesley Student - What are some aspects of your favorite courses/approaches to learning? - What responsibilities are you all juggling? - Anything else I should know about teaching at Wellesley? ## Housekeeping - Office Hours - Centering Activity? - Accessing Course Website - Set Shared Expectations ## Office Hours - Currently, I have appointment slots for: - T/F: 11:15 AM - 12:15 PM - W: 2-4 PM - Any scheduling challenges I should be aware of? ## Centering Activity (optional){.smaller} - Life is busy, and we often have millions of things on our minds - Centering activities are brief activities (< 5 minutes) meant to bring everyone into the present - A student would be in charge of leading before each class - This could be... - A breathing exercise - A silly doodle - A journaling activity - Reading your favorite poem - Sharing your favorite new song - Are we into this? ## Course Website bookmark: https://mariahdaniellecaballero.github.io/ES-202/ ## Schedule You can access the weekly schedule on the course website. ![](images/schedule.png) ## Setting Shared Expectations{.smaller} - How do we want to be accountable to one another? - This could mean agreeing to... - Not use phones within a course session - Assuming best intentions from peers - Engaging in class conversation - Listening to and respecting others' perspectives Take 5 minutes with a partner to discuss, be ready to share at least one! ## For Friday - Check course website for readings - Preview first assignment and come prepared with questions

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
